DOC.brief_summary: To examine impact prenatal infancy home visiting nurse child age 2 12 .
DOC.brief_title: Age 12 Follow-up Early Preventive Intervention ( Memphis )
DOC.detailed_description: This study longitudinal follow-up 679 low-income woman ( 89 % African American ) firstborn subsequent child participate randomized trial prenatal infancy home visiting nurse Memphis , Tennessee since 1988 . The study conduct first-born child complete sixth grade , around 12th birthday . The current follow-up design determine whether : ) nurse-visited woman differ comparison group woman life-course outcome ( number space subsequent pregnancy birth ; rate marriage cohabitation father child ; employment , career growth , economic self-sufficiency , welfare dependence ; behavioral problem due substance abuse ; arrest serious misdemeanor felony ) ; b ) child nurse-visited woman differ comparison-children academic achievement , placement special education , rate grade retention , conduct school , academic achievement ; c ) low rate developmental disability , grade retention , placement special education , school disciplinary action among subsequent child bear nurse-visited woman ; ) nurse-visited family fewer government expenditures high tax pay ; e ) effect program child outcomes concentrated child bear woman low psychological resource ; f ) effect program maternal life course government cost concentrate woman high psychological resource ; g ) effect program child great school neighborhood contain great risk academic behavioral problem ; h ) effect program child 's disruptive behavior problem explain combined effect program maternal life-course , quality parental care-giving , child 's sequential processing skill , aggressive violent theme , reliance adult , story incoherence response McArthur Story Stem Battery early assessment . Data derive maternal interview review state administrative school record . Results trial provide policy maker estimate likely long-term effect program conduct close real-life condition .
DOC.criteria: Women < 29 week gestation No previous live birth At least 2 sociodemographic risk characteristic ; e.g . unmarried , < 12 year education , unemployed .
